sentences.sContent: The Economist considers itself the enemy of privilege, pomposity and predictability.
sentences.sContent_eng: The Economist considers itself the enemy of privilege, pomposity and predictability.
sentences.sCn: 经济学人将自己视为特权、浮夸和预言家的敌人。

sentences.sContent: They were annoyed by my pomposity my insistence on taking the blame for the whole affair.
sentences.sContent_eng: They were annoyed by my pomposity my insistence on taking the blame for the whole affair.
sentences.sCn: 他们为我的傲慢自大，为我的非要承担整个事情的责任而感到生气。

remMethod.val: 来自pomp(n. 炫耀； 盛况)

words.tran: 自大的；浮夸的；华而不实的；爱炫耀的
